ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.

detailedSolution:
From the first square on the left, rotate the square <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>30</mn>
      <mo>∘<!-- ∘ --></mo>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{30^ \circ }</annotation></semantics></math> to the right, or <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mn>1</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mn>2</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A1 \to A2</annotation></semantics></math>. Then, reflect the square over the horizontal, or <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mn>3</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A2 \to A3</annotation></semantics></math>. Next, reflect all three squares over the vertical line. The lavender triangles comprise another pattern that tessellates, fits in with the squares, and fills the gaps.
